definition: simplified Chinese character
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The first one, all of us have familiar with simple-formed characters.
sentences.chinese: 首先，所有的人都對簡化字很熟悉。

sentences.english: Who Can Benefit from This Guide of Traditional and Simplified Chinese Characters?
sentences.chinese: 誰應該使用這個繁體字和簡化字指南？

sentences.english: The change process of Chinese traditional and simplified characters was proposed.
sentences.chinese: 中華漢字繁體字與簡化字的變革過程。

sentences.english: Simplified Chinese characters don't contain any variant forms of these characters.
sentences.chinese: 經過改革後的簡化字基本不再使用異體字。

sentences.english: I do not think we should use complex-formed characters to instead of simple-formed characters.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲我們應該用繁體字來代替簡化字。

definition: writings in the vernacular
standard form (of a Chinese character)/plain font style (as opposed to bold or italic)/printed style (as opposed to cursive)/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
simple versus traditional (Chinese characters)
horizontal setting (printing)
simplified form of Chinese characters, as opposed to traditional form 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3]
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
word order
clauses and sub-clauses (in formal document)/entry (in a dictionary, encyclopedia etc)
to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
